author: Staff Reporter
text:
Thoothukudi District Passengers’ Association has welcomed the Railway Budget, presented by Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu on Thursday, saying the announcement on allotment of Rs.100 crore for doubling the tracks from Madurai to Thoothukudi was a pleasant surprise.

Further, the allocation of Rs.20 crore for laying a new rail line from Madurai to Thoothukudi via Aruppukottai was another surprise, said its secretary M. Piramanayagam.

All India Chamber of Commerce and Industries in Thoothukudi has also welcomed the budget for not increasing the passenger fare. It was certainly a big relief for the common man, its president P.S.S.K. Raja Sankaralingam said.

He also welcomed the announcement on ‘Antyodaya Express,’ the fully unreserved superfast trains proposed on dense traffic routes.

Increasing the capacity of e-ticketing system, providing bio-toilets and cleaning of toilets through SMS requests were the key highlights of the budget.

Increasing the quota to 50 percent for senior citizens and women was also a good measure, he said.

S.K.S.C.N. Dharmaraj, former chairman of Confederation of Indian Industry, Thoothukudi, said that it was a ‘balanced budget.’

The decision to cut freight on commodities such as iron, steel, cement and oil would give relief to industries facing slump in the market.

It was also a welcome relief that the Railway Minister did not effect hike in freight, he said.

“Increasing the quota to 50 percent for senior citizens and women, a good measure”
title: A pleasant surprise for Thoothukudi
